Execution of host binaries/scripts (e.g..Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4663, Windows Event ID 1102
Execution of host binaries/scripts (e.g..Action: Monitor process creation logs (Event ID 4688) for execution of `wevtutil.exe`, `powershell.exe` with command-line arguments related to log enumeration/export (e.g., `get-winevent`, `export-forwardedevents`). Monitor object access logs (Event ID 4663) for suspicious access to log files. Look for Event ID 1102 (Security log cleared). Use correlation analysis to link process execution to log file access or external network connections (Zeek conn.log).

Unusual access patterns or bulk data tra.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for unusually large data transfers originating from potential log sources (endpoints, servers) towards unusual internal or external destinations. Use descriptive statistics and box plots on bytes transferred per connection/host to identify outliers. Monitor object access logs (Event ID 4663) for suspicious access to log files that precedes large data transfers.
